poem:
The Search for Nirvana  

She walks through roles, her stage  
a landscape sprawling wide,  
yet seeks in cups the quiet bliss,  
a warmth not fully found.  
Gold once in hand, still  
the simple brew eludes her grip,  
as stars across a screen  
dim beside the morning's quest.  
Here in the steam, she dreams anew.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Three things with Lisa McCune: ‘I’ve never found coffee nirvana, but this machine comes close’ It was 1993 when Australia first met Lisa McCune as Constable Maggie Doyle on Blue Heelers. McCune played that small town country cop for seven seasons, winning viewers’ hearts – and four straight Gold Logie awards. Since then, McCune has gone on to a long list of TV and film roles. She is also a regular on stage and now". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
